info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 4:23AM MST until January 13 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches with locally higher totals in and around the Big Holes. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Arco/Mud Lake Desert, Upper Snake River Plain, Big Hole Mountains, and Teton Valley, including but not limited to Mud Lake, INL, Craters of the Moon NM, Idaho Falls, Rexburg, St. Anthony, Victor, Ashton, Tetonia, and Driggs. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 9 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
